sample_embeddings.text: The sky appears blue because of Rayleigh scattering: as sunlight passes through the atmosphere, shorter (blue) wavelengths are scattered more than longer (red) wavelengths, giving the sky its blue hue.

questions.comm: The question 'Why is the sky blue?' is factual and well-known, but using RAG can help fetch detailed scientific explanations and references.

questions.q: Who is the president of the United States?
questions.comm: Questions about political figures and news require up-to-date information, which RAG can provide by retrieving current data.

questions.q: Who is the CEO of ClickIT?
questions.comm: Questions about corporate leadership among other data may benefit from RAG to ensure that the latest company information is retrieved.

questions.q: How do I repair a CX50 core?
questions.comm: Technical questions may require access to detailed repair manuals or troubleshooting guides, which is a strong case for RAG.
